sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
A pleasaunt dialogue, concerning phisicke and phisitions Mexía, Pedro, 1496?-1552? Newton, Thomas, 1542?-1607, attributed name.
[80] p.
By Iohn Charlewood, Imprinted at London : 1580.
With an additional title page: A delectable dialogue: .. Translated out of the Castlin tongue. By T.N. T.N. = Thomas Newton? --STC. A translation of Mexía's "Dialogo de los medicos" from his "Dialogos o coloquios". Signatures: A-E. Running title reads: A dialogue concerning phisick and phisitions. Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
=======

By Iohn Charlewood, Imprinted at London : 1580.
With an additional title page: A delectable dialogue: .. Translated out of the Castlin tongue. By T.N. T.N. = Thomas Newton? --STC. A translation of Mexía's "Dialogo de los medicos" from his "Dialogos o coloquios". Signatures: A-E. Running title reads: A dialogue concerning phisick and phisitions. Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
Iohn Charlewood
